body:
Hello @jorisvandenbossche! Thanks for updating this PR. We checked the lines you've touched for [PEP 8](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008) issues, and found:



* In the file [`pandas/core/sorting.py`](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/8db84e7cef94a9a6215a2ba0acf46e587ea82485/pandas/core/sorting.py):

> [Line 408:72](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/8db84e7cef94a9a6215a2ba0acf46e587ea82485/pandas/core/sorting.py#L408): [W291](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20W291) trailing whitespace







##### Comment last updated at 2019-04-05 12:55:16 UTC

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25696?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [fc5f292...8db84e7](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25696?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Coming back to this

> would rather just fix take_1d

For `take_1d` itself, I am not sure it makes a lot of sense to support this. Currently, it is by definition that -1 values in the `indexer` passed to take signal missing values. The only use case for having this configurable would be this one, while it complicates the interface throughout pandas (eg also EAs would need to support this, as `take_1d` dispatch to them)
